perturbation.original_text: Before a user can gain access to the website, they must first verify their birthday (users must be 21 and over to even view the website).
perturbation.changed_text: Before a user can gain access to the website, they may be asked to verify their birthday.
perturbation.explanation: Washington State law requires strict age verification for cannabis-related websites. Changing 'must' to 'may be asked' introduces a legal loophole, suggesting that age verification is not consistently enforced, potentially violating state regulations regarding access to cannabis-related content by underage individuals. This weakens consumer protections.

perturbation.original_text: Users will pay by linking their bank accounts via Evergreen Gateway o Account information will be stored and used for future orders o Once payment is confirmed users may proceed to completing their order · Age / ID Verification o After payment is confirmed users must upload their government issued ID and a selfie o Trulioo will verify if the issued ID is valid and if the selfie matches the ID o Once verification is completed the user will be able to complete the order
perturbation.changed_text: Users will pay by linking their bank accounts via Evergreen Gateway o Account information may be stored and used for future orders o Once payment is confirmed users may proceed to completing their order · Age / ID Verification o After payment is confirmed users may upload their government issued ID and a selfie o Verification of the issued ID and the selfie's match to the ID may be completed to use the order
perturbation.explanation: Removing the mandatory storage of customer account information introduces a legal contradiction with Washington State's data retention and consumer protection laws, which require explicit consent for data storage and clear policies on data usage. Changing 'must' to 'may' weakens this legal requirement and consumer rights. This weakens consumer protections.

perturbation.original_text: Driver will scan the customers ID using the Trulioo API right before they handle the delivery to the customer. After this last ID check, the transaction will be completed.
perturbation.changed_text: Driver may check the customer's ID before handling the delivery. After the ID check, the transaction may be completed.
perturbation.explanation: Washington State regulations mandate strict ID verification for cannabis delivery to ensure compliance with age restrictions. Changing 'will scan' to 'may check' introduces ambiguity and the possibility of non-compliance. Moreover, removing the reference to Trulioo API eliminates the requirement for a validated method of age and ID verification. This creates a legal loophole, potentially violating state regulations and enabling illegal sales to underage individuals. This weakens consumer protections.
